meanings.sent1: The quinary fingers on my hand help me grasp things.
meanings.sent2: The quinary petals of the flower were a vibrant red.
meanings.sent3: I always feel like a superhero with my quinary fingers when I play piano.
meanings.sent4: The quinary stars in the night sky sparkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The quinary colors of the rainbow painted a beautiful arc in the sky.

meanings.sent1: She won the quinary prize in the art competition.
meanings.sent2: The quinary place in the race was a great achievement.
meanings.sent3: Being the quinary student to finish the test made her proud.
meanings.sent4: The quinary row in the theater had the best view of the stage.
meanings.sent5: The quinary chapter of the book revealed a surprising twist.

meanings.definition: A group or set of five.
meanings.sent1: The quinary of friends went on a hike together.
meanings.sent2: She bought a quinary of cupcakes for the party.
meanings.sent3: The quinary of puppies played joyfully in the park.
meanings.sent4: The quinary of trees stood tall in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The quinary of planets aligned perfectly in the night sky.
